intro: Indigofera langlassei, commonly known as the African indigo. It is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to parts of Africa. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to violet. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Indigofera langlassei is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types.
